See also: computer and compùter

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

Borrowed from English computer.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /kɔmˈpjuːtɐ/
  • audio
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Computer m (genitive Computers, plural Computer)

  1. computer (programmable electronic device that performs mathematical calculations, logical operations, and usually also data retrieval/storage)
    Synonym: Rechner

Declension[edit]

Declension of Computer
singularplural
indef.def.noundef.noun
nominativeeinderComputerdieComputer
genitiveeinesdesComputersderComputer
dativeeinemdemComputerdenComputern
accusativeeinendenComputerdieComputer

Luxembourgish[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From English computer, partly through German Computer.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /komˈpjuːteʀ/, [komˈpjuːtɐ]

Noun[edit]

Computer m (plural Computeren)

  1. computer
